title: RIIO-2 price control: Energy Networks Association responds
lead: David Smith, CEO of the ENA said: ‘Achieving net zero emissions requires sustained investment, innovation and a supportive and forward-looking regulatory regime’

title: Ofgem finalises RIIO-2 price control to direct £40m of funding into electricity network
lead: Approximately £30bn will help establish a ‘stronger, greener and fairer GB energy system’, while more than £10m will be held on standby to pay for future green energy projects

title: British Embassy in Dakar calls for bids for climate change projects
lead: Projects can focus on areas including clean growth, green finance, nature-based solutions and climate change adaptation and resilience

title: Global floating wind capacity ‘to grow 2,000-fold by 2050’
lead: A new study predicts installed capacity of floating wind will soar from its current level of 100MW to as much as 250GW by mid-century

title: ScottishPower chosen to take on Yorkshire Energy customers
lead: Around 74,000 domestic customers and a small number of business customers will now move to ScottishPower following a competitive process run by Ofgem

title: Welsh town to trial new digital deposit return scheme for plastic bottles
lead: Digital DRS schemes allow local authorities, brands and regulators to monitor recycling rates so they can analyse the habits of households

title: Government announces £12m for planting 500 hectares of trees in the next five months
lead: The new package will finance ten community forests in various regions, including Yorkshire, Manchester and Bristol

title: Demand for BEVs soared by 122% in November
lead: BEVs recorded their third-highest ever monthly share of registrations at 9.1%, according to a new report

title: Greece referred to EU Court over poor air quality
lead: The Commission said Greece has not taken adequate measures for the reduction of PM10 concentrations in the agglomeration of Thessaloniki

title: ‘World’s oceans could be flooded with 1.5bn face masks by the end of 2020’
lead: Oceans globally face an additional 4,680 to 6,240 tonnes of marine plastic pollution, fuelled by the use of single-use PPE
